newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: FORECAST - RAND SEEN BUOYING TRENCOR H1 SHR.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - RAND SEEN BUOYING TRENCOR H1 SHR.

text.p: Transport and container firm Trencor Ltd was expected to report a healthy rise in earnings for the six months to December 31, but a continued surge in the rand could cut into second half profits, analysts said Friday.
Analysts polled by Reuters forecast earnings rising to between 51.9 and 72 cents, with consensus at 60.3 compared with 51.9 at the halfway stage in 1995 -- a rise of over 16 percent.
Trencor is due to report results on Tuesday.

Analysts said the 29 percent depreciation of the rand against the dollar last year could put a sparkle in Trencor's earnings since about 80 percent of profits came from its container unit Textainer which earns mainly foreign currency.
"They (Trencor) are a company which is positively favoured by the weakness in the rand," said an analyst who asked not to be identified.
However, other analysts were less upbeat predicting a flat performance.
Profits in the second half to end June 1997 were seen curbed if the rand, which has recovered almost six percent since the beginning of the year, continued its rally.
"The outlook for the future is good but at the moment with the rand continuing to strengthen things could be tough for their second half," an analyst said.
The half year dividend was forecast at between 12 and 14 cents a share, compared with 12 at the last interim.
